programme.title: Fever Pitch
programme.desc: A teacher (Colin Firth), obsessed with soccer and a team that hasn't won a league cup in 18 years, begins a shaky relationship.

programme.title: Bloodfist VII: Manhunt
programme.desc: A former special-forces agent (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) finds himself embroiled in police corruption and accused of murder.

programme.title: The Getaway
programme.desc: An explosives-expert thief (Alec Baldwin) and his wife (Kim Basinger) cross a crime lord and are chased to the Mexican border.

programme.title: Clockwatchers
programme.desc: Friendship helps make nightmarish office jobs bearable for four young women working as temporary employees.

programme.title: The Super
programme.desc: Ordered to live among his tenants in squalor, a New York slumlord (Joe Pesci) does so and sees the light.

programme.title: Bloodfist III: Forced to Fight
programme.desc: An innocent half-Asian kickboxer (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) is caught between two other races at war in prison.

programme.title: Space Truckers
programme.desc: A freight pilot (Dennis Hopper), his girlfriend (Debi Mazar) and an apprentice (Stephen Dorff) try to deliver cargo to Earth in 2197.

programme.title: A Midnight Clear
programme.desc: A young GI (Ethan Hawke) and his squad have a strange encounter with Germans in the Ardennes forest, December 1944.

programme.title: The Crush
programme.desc: A writer (Cary Elwes) moves into a wealthy family's guest house and befriends a precocious 14-year-old daughter (Alicia Silverstone).

programme.title: Bloodfist VI: Ground Zero
programme.desc: A kickboxer (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) must prevent the launch of a nuclear missile by terrorists targeting New York.

programme.title: Doppelganger
programme.desc: A young woman flees New York City after being implicated in a murder and moves to Los Angeles, where she rents a room from a writer. They begin an affair, but it seems she's been followed by a homicidal duplicate of herself.

programme.title: The Commitments
programme.desc: An Irish hustler (Robert Arkins) puts together a Dublin band that covers hits of 1960s American soul.

programme.title: The Final Sacrifice
programme.desc: A teenager's investigation into his father's death leads him to a hidden city populated with menacing warriors.

programme.title: Dr. Giggles
programme.desc: An asylum escapee (Larry Drake) plays doctor on a killing spree, then decides to do a heart transplant.
